articles.author: Isabella Kwai
articles.title: Samoa Lifts State of Emergency After Deadly Measles Epidemic
articles.description: The Pacific island nation will reopen schools after a measles epidemic killed 81 people, many of them children and babies.
articles.content: In 2013, 90 percent of Samoan infants received the measles-mumps-rubella vaccine by the time they were one-year-old. But by last year, the vaccination rate had dropped to 30 percent. The government said it had been complacent in routine immunizations. When tw… [+1057 chars]

articles.author: nicholassenn
articles.title: Opinion | Twitter Made Us Better - The New York Times
articles.description: These days, everyone thinks it’s a cesspit. But it’s changed whose voices we hear. That’s a good thing.
articles.content:
Its impossible to avoid news about how harmful social media can be. The Cambridge Analytica scandal. The ubiquitous Russian bots. The lackadaisical response of tech industry leaders to privacy violations, election meddling and harassment. 
All the optimism a… [+7370 chars]

articles.author: Oskar Garcia
articles.title: Trevor Lawrence Puts Clemson Back in the National Championship Game
articles.description: The Clemson quarterback took the Tigers 94 yards in four plays late in the fourth quarter to defeat Ohio State, 29-23, in the semifinal of the College Football Playoff.
articles.content: Clemson quarterback Trevor Lawrence put the reigning champion Tigers back in the national title game for the second straight year, taking his team 94 yards in just four plays late in the game to edge Ohio State, 29-23, after a grinding, back-and-forth semifin… [+641 chars]

articles.author: David D. Kirkpatrick
articles.title: How Chase Bank Chairman Helped the Deposed Shah of Iran Enter the U.S.
articles.description: The fateful decision in 1979 to admit Mohammed Reza Pahlavi prompted the seizure of the American Embassy in Tehran and helped doom the Carter presidency.
articles.content:
A week later, Mr. Rockefeller personally urged Mr. Carter in a phone call to direct the secretary of state to meet with the shah about the current situation. Mr. Carter did not and the shah soon departed, for Panama, then Egypt. 
Only after the death of the … [+1201 chars]

articles.author: Choe Sang-Hun
articles.title: North Korea Convenes Party Meeting, Raising Fears of New Weapons Tests
articles.description: Analysts warned that Kim Jong-un, the North Korean leader, might end a moratorium on testing long-range missiles and nuclear weapons.
articles.content:
Two months later, he met President Trump in Singapore for the first ever summit meeting between the sitting leaders of the North and the United States. 
North Korea sounded victorious after the Singapore summit, in which Mr. Kim promised to work toward compl… [+1988 chars]

articles.author: Neil Vigdor
articles.title: Monsey Stabbing: Several Wounded at Rabbi’s Home in N.Y. Suburb - The New York Times
articles.description: Monsey Stabbing: Several Wounded at Rabbi’s Home in N.Y. Suburb The New York Times New York synagogue stabbing attack results in several injuries: reports Fox News Multiple stab victims reported at synagogue in upstate New York Daily Mail View full coverage o…
articles.content:
A knife attack at the home of a rabbi in a New York suburb on Saturday night left several people with stab wounds, an official said.
The home of the ultra-Orthodox rabbi was in Monsey, N.Y., an area with a large population of ultra-Orthodox Jews.
